div1.head: Report: Walter Reed and Yellow Fever, Chronology of the Yellow Fever Work in Cuba, 1899 and 1900 and personal experiences, by Jefferson Randolph Kean, June 1, 1929
div1.p: June 1?? 1929- FROM GEN. J. R. KEAN

list.head:
WALTER REED & YELLOW FEVER............
CHRONOLOGY OF THE YELLOW FEVER WORK IN CUBA, 1899 and 1900
and personal experiences. (Gen Kean)
list.item: Saw my first case of yellow fever, an autopsy of a Private, Bat'n Engineers.... Jan. 24/99
Called on O'Reilly and Gorgas in Havana ....................................... Jan. 25/99
Saw case of yellow fever in 4th Ill. Inf.......................................Mar. 2/99
Death of Major Paul Clendennin, M.C. from yellow fever.......................July 4, 1899
Case of yellow fever in 7th Cavalry, Camp Columbia...........................July 17 "
Fatal Case at Quemados next to Slocum's house in Calzada.....................Aug. 17 "
Gen. Ludlow applied for me to replace Davis, Feb. 2; Gen. Ludlow left Havana Feb. 3 1900
Gorgas appointed Acting Chief Sanitary Officer of the City of Havana........Feb. 10, 1900

Reed arrived in Havana to look into Electrozone Plant.......................Mar. 10 "
At reception of General Ludlow on January 1st, he told me he has
asked General Wood for me in presence of Gen. Lee to be Sanitary
officer, but General Lee has refused to give me up.
His Order changed so as to report to Gen. Lee..................................May 1 "
Changed by cable and became Chief Sanitary Officer of Havana...May 1 "

Gorgas relieved as Chief Surgeon Dept. of Havana, to which he was
appointed Jan. 13, 1899, and appointed Chief Sanitary Officer..............May 1 "
Two other cases - 26 in a month; General Lee orders me not to see cases.
after seeing Major Edmunds about June 16th He lived at 27 Gen Lee St
Reed arrived in Cuba, and came to see me same day.........................June 25 "
Reed went to see cases at Pinar del Rio...................................July 31 "
Reed left Cuba for U.S. to finish report Typhoid Committee between Aug. 3 & Aug. 11 "
First experiments by Board with mosquitoes - Dr. A.S. Pinto and others... Aug. 11 "
Pvt. Wm. H. Dean, Troop B, 7th Cav. (X.Y.) bitten.......................Aug. 31 "
Reed and I go to see General Wood.......................................Oct. 12 "
I issue circular as to mosquito work. for Doctor Havana & Pinar del Rio. ...Oct. 15
Havard goes to U.S., and I became C.S...................................Nov. 19

Experiments with fomites begin..........................................Nov. 30
until Jan. 10, 1901 - Dr. R. P. Cooke and others
Kissinger bitten by infected mosquito Nov. 20, Nov. 23 and............. Dec. 5

Dinner to Dr. Carlos Finlay to celebrate the demonstration of Reed of
his theory............................................................. Dec. 22

General Wood, Finlay, Reed, Gorgas and about 60 Cuban physicians
there. I sat on Dr. Finlay's right.
* Oct. 4, 1900 - Reed returned. from United States
I left Havana for Washington for examination for promotion as Major....Jan. 30 "

I talked to Gorgas just before leaving and urged him to join the rest
of us in accepting Reed's demonstration before the Pan American Med. Congress
met in Feb. He said that he believed that Reed had been able to carry it
by the bites of mosquitoes, but he did not believe that it was the only
way, or even the most usual way.
Last case of yellow fever originating in Havana........................... May 7
Reed's article in Medical Record Aug. 10..................................Aug. 10
Gorgas ceases disinfection bedding and clothing...........................Aug. 15

Walter Reed died in Washington 2:05 a. m. Sunday - . Nov 23rd 1902
see my diary Vol V
